title: Team cape

properties.name: description
properties.value: Team capes (also known as Wilderness capes) are purchased for 50 coins from various Cape merchants. Alternatively, three[1] are obtainable only through the completion of a Clue scroll (easy) or the Grand Exchange.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Team cape

Team capes (also known as Wilderness capes) are purchased for 50 coins from various Cape merchants. Alternatively, three[1] are obtainable only through the completion of a Clue scroll (easy) or the Grand Exchange.

Another player with the same team cape equipped will show up on the minimap as a blue dot rather than white, and the left-click "Attack" option will be moved to a right-click, as if the other player is of higher level than the player. These capes are primarily used as a precaution between adventuring friends and player killers in a group or clan.

Team capes, regular coloured capes, and the cabbage cape provide the same bonuses and weigh the same, making all three types of capes the best-in-slot cape for free-to-play.

  • 1 Team cape colours and patterns
  • 2 Treasure Trails
  • 3 Sellers

Team cape colours and patterns[edit | edit source]

A map showing the locations of the cape sellers.

There are currently 50 cape designs made up of five different colours: pink, yellow, blue, green, and red; and 10 different designs.

The coloured capes are organised into as:

Colour Numbers
Pink 1-10
Yellow 11-20
Blue 21-30
Green 31-40
Red 41-50

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

Tier Emotes STASH Location Items Cost
Medium Cheer & Headbang Centre of the Barbarian Outpost Agility Course 1,604
Medium Yawn & Shrug Castle Wars bank 2,063

Sellers[edit | edit source]

Main article: Cape merchants
Team number Cape pattern Seller Location Capes
1, 11, 21, 31, 41 Box William Level 35-48, around Lava Dragon Isle or by the Demonic Ruins. Sometimes seen near the perimeter of the spider-invaded hill.
2, 12, 22, 32, 42 X Ian Level 30, Forgotten Cemetery
3, 13, 23, 33, 43 Cross Larry Outside the Chaos Temple and the Graveyard of Shadows. It is hard to find him sometimes, as he wanders around in level 13 to 26 Wilderness.
4, 14, 24, 34, 44 Dashed lines Darren East of the Wilderness Agility Course. Only accessible to members.
5, 15, 25, 35, 45 Horizontal stripes Edward Level 55, far east of Demonic Ruins, in the "New Castle." Only accessible to members.
6, 16, 26, 36, 46 Box at top Richard In Edgeville, by the Wilderness ditch.
7, 17, 27, 37, 47 Scarab Neil Level 25, inside the Bandit Camp.
8, 18, 28, 38, 48 Circle Edmond North of the Hobgoblin mine.
9, 19, 29, 39, 49 Outline Simon Level 13, in the Chaos Temple.
10, 20, 30, 40, 50 Claw Sam Level 14, east of the Dark Warriors' Fortress.

Prices[edit | edit source]

At current prices, the cheapest cape is the Team-36 cape (22) and the most expensive cape is the Team-1 cape (653).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 May 2013
(update | poll)

Team capes are now available on the worlds with F2P-style restrictions.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When first released, pink team capes were initially white team capes, but were changed to pink due to looking similar to the cape of legends.
  • The first letters of each of the sellers of the team capes (when read in order of 1-10) spells "WILDERNESS".
